intro: Viguiera santacatarinensis, commonly known as the Santa Catarina heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Viguiera santacatarinensis is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinators.
